DataElement.preferredDefinition: A grouping of data results from a 4D positron emission tomography (PET) imaging study.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Positron emission tomography imaging collected over time. It is designed to capture the internal movement of organs and the metabolism of the tumor.  It creates the most complete and accurate information on the tumor and provides information how the tumor moves with breathing and other body motions._A collection or single item of factual information, derived from measurement or research, from which conclusions may be drawn._The result of an action.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
